term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - premix burner in flame spectroscopy
term.title: premix burner

item.text: A burner in which fuel and oxidant are thoroughly mixed inside the burner housing before they leave the burner ports and enter the primary-combustion or inner zone of the flame. This type of burner usually produces an approximately laminar flame, and is commonly combined with a separate unit for nebulizing the sample.
